name: Fort Washington Park
description: Built to defend the river approach to Washington, DC, Fort Washington has stood sentry for over 200 years. As technologies advanced, so did Fort Washington from the brick and stone of the 19th century to the concrete and steel of the 20th century.
shortDescription: Built to defend the river approach to Washington, DC, Fort Washington has stood sentry for over 200 years. As technologies advanced, so did Fort Washington from the brick and stone of the 19th century...

climate.weatherDescription: Summers are generally hot and humid, with daytime highs frequently above 90 degrees Fahrenheit and scattered afternoon thunderstorms. Please carry water while participating in physical activity and be prepared to take shelter from lightning. Winters are generally cold, with nighttime lows frequently near freezing and occasional snowfall. Weather during spring and fall is generally moderate, but can change quickly.

images.title: Entrance to Fort Washington
images.altText: Entrance way into historic Fort Washington
images.caption: Fort Washington Entrance

images.title: Fort Washington Volunteers firing a cannon
images.altText: Fort Washington Volunteers firing a cannon
images.caption: Fort Washington Guard fires one of the park's cannons.  Demonstrations are presented during the summer months April-October.

images.title: Potomac View
images.altText: a green shoreline with small lighthouse along river at sunset
images.caption: Fort Washington offers great views of the Potomac River, especially at sunset.

images.title: Picnic Area at Fort Washington Park
images.caption: Picnic areas available to reserve.

images.title: Cannon crew at Fort Washington
images.altText: Men in blue army uniforms pose by a cannon.
images.caption: Check out the park's cannon demonstrations to experience the sights, sounds, and smells of the past!

images.title: Fort tour
images.altText: A female park ranger talks with a man and woman in a fort
images.caption: A park ranger gives a tour of the fort
